review_notes: Success scenario should explicitly mention the validation for the description length (3-300 characters) and the uniqueness of the title as part of the flow, not just in failure scenarios.
Failure scenarios are well-covered but could include a case where the image URL is invalid to cover all input validation aspects.
Success scenarios adequately cover the viewing and sorting functionalities.
Failure scenario for no badges is good, but consider adding a scenario for when sorting fails due to server issues.
Success scenario is clear but could specify the interaction more, like 'clicking on an image enlarges it in a modal or slider'.
Failure scenario is appropriate but could also mention the placeholder's design or text for better clarity.
Success scenario should detail what 'edit the badge's details' includes, such as which fields can be edited.
Failure scenarios are comprehensive but could add a scenario for when the server fails to update the badge.
Failure scenario could include a case where the badge cannot be deleted due to server issues, not just permission issues.
Failure scenario could be expanded to include cases where the authentication service is unavailable.
Coverage: The user stories collectively match the original requirements well.
Epics and Tiny Stories: No stories are too large or too small; they are appropriately sized.
Functional focus: All stories are functionally focused, with no non-functional requirements included.
Testability: Scenarios are concrete and testable.
User-centric: Flows reflect real user behavior effectively.
